keyMoments.title: Koala's Introduction
keyMoments.description: Koala is introduced as a traumatized young human slave girl whom the Sun Pirates are asked to escort home. She displays severe psychological damage from slavery, constantly smiling, cleaning, and apologizing.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces a character who becomes significant later as a Revolutionary Army member and powerfully illustrates the psychological trauma of slavery in the One Piece world.

keyMoments.title: Koala's Trauma Displayed
keyMoments.description: Koala frantically scrubs the deck while apologizing profusely, even after being beaten by Arlong. Her behavior shocks the Sun Pirates and reveals the depth of psychological conditioning imposed by the Celestial Dragons.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the horrific psychological impact of slavery and begins to change even the human-hating fish-men's perspectives.

keyMoments.title: Slave Mark Removed
keyMoments.description: Fisher Tiger removes Koala's Celestial Dragon slave brand and replaces it with the Sun Pirates' symbol, telling her it's alright to cry and that they're not like the World Nobles.
keyMoments.significance: Symbolic moment of true liberation - both physical and psychological. Tiger's compassion begins Koala's healing journey.

keyMoments.title: Koala's First Tears
keyMoments.description: After Tiger's declaration and the removal of her slave mark, Koala breaks down and cries for the first time since her enslavement.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the breaking of psychological conditioning and the beginning of emotional freedom. The climax of Koala's arc in this episode.

statusHistory.note: Was enslaved by Celestial Dragons before being freed by Fisher Tiger

relationships.description: Fisher Tiger freed Koala from slavery in Mary Geoise and later helped her overcome her psychological trauma by removing her slave mark and encouraging her to express emotions.

evolutionMoments.description: Tiger removes Koala's slave mark and helps her cry for the first time.

reveals.information: Was enslaved by the Celestial Dragons and freed by Fisher Tiger's attack on Mary Geoise
Suffered severe psychological conditioning that made her unable to cry and compelled her to constantly clean and apologize

keyMoments.title: Kadar's Debut
keyMoments.description: Rear Admiral Kadar appears leading a Marine battleship that confronts the Sun Pirates, demanding the return of all slaves freed by Fisher Tiger.
keyMoments.significance: Represents the World Government's response to Tiger's liberation of slaves and establishes Marine pursuit of the Sun Pirates.
keyMoments.quote: Return all the slaves Tiger freed!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Fisher Tiger
keyMoments.description: Kadar is brutally defeated by Fisher Tiger, who hits his head against a wall during the underwater battle.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Fisher Tiger's combat prowess and the Sun Pirates' dominance in underwater warfare.

reveals.information: Rear Admiral stationed at G-2 Marine base

name.japanese: フィッシャー・タイガー

keyMoments.title: Defeats Rear Admiral Kadar
keyMoments.description: Tiger defeats Kadar in combat, demonstrating the Sun Pirates' strength and his commitment to protecting freed slaves.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Tiger's combat abilities and determination to defend those he freed from slavery.
keyMoments.quote: We can't tell who was a slave anymore!

keyMoments.title: Philosophy of Liberation
keyMoments.description: Tiger scolds Arlong for killing a Marine and gives a speech about liberation over revenge, but privately confesses to Jinbe about his inner demons.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals the complexity of Tiger's character and his internal struggle between idealism and trauma-induced hatred.
keyMoments.quote: This is about liberation and freedom, not revenge!

keyMoments.title: Removes Koala's Slave Mark
keyMoments.description: Tiger brands Koala with the Sun Pirates symbol over her slave mark and passionately declares she's free to cry and express emotions.
keyMoments.significance: The emotional climax showing Tiger's true heroism - providing not just physical but psychological liberation.
keyMoments.quote: It's alright to cry! We're not like those stupid World Nobles!

bounties.reason: Captain of the Sun Pirates and liberating slaves from Mary Geoise

abilities.description: Uses powerful fish-man karate techniques in combat against Marines.

relationships.description: Tiger is Arlong's captain but frequently clashes with him over Arlong's violent hatred of humans.

evolutionMoments.description: Tiger scolds Arlong for killing a Marine, highlighting their philosophical differences.

relationships.description: Jinbe is Tiger's trusted first mate and confidant whom Tiger trusts with his deepest struggles.

evolutionMoments.description: Tiger confides to Jinbe about the demons inside him that wish to kill humans.

relationships.description: Tiger freed Koala from slavery and helps her overcome psychological trauma, showing fatherly compassion.

evolutionMoments.description: Tiger removes Koala's slave mark and helps her cry, beginning her healing process.

reveals.information: Bounty of 230 million berries issued by Kizaru
Struggles with inner demons that wish to kill humans despite his philosophy of liberation

keyMoments.title: Tiger's Confession
keyMoments.description: Jinbe receives Tiger's private confession about harboring demons that wish to kill humans, showing the trust between them.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Jinbe's role as Tiger's most trusted confidant and witness to his internal struggles.

bounties.reason: First mate of the Sun Pirates

reveals.information: First bounty of 76 million berries as member of Sun Pirates

keyMoments.title: Kills a Marine
keyMoments.description: Arlong brutally kills a Marine during the confrontation, defying Fisher Tiger's philosophy of liberation over revenge.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Arlong's deep-seated hatred of humans and foreshadows the ideological split within the Sun Pirates.

keyMoments.title: Beats Koala
keyMoments.description: Arlong violently beats Koala simply for being human, but even he is disturbed by her traumatized response.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the extent of Arlong's hatred while also revealing that even he is affected by the reality of slavery's psychological damage.

reveals.information: Displays extreme hatred toward humans, killing a Marine and abusing Koala
